data.text: @LegoLas44941816 @casertron3000 Sure they will. "freedumb" rhetoric led swiftly enough to: "lockdown opponents are bad people who deserve to die of Covid". Now we just have a new group who deserve to die for being bad: Russians.

@LegoLas44941816 I doubt that the libs you refer to have the capacity to recognise or understand the change that they have just undertaken

Virtue, once signalled, has a very short half life / memory. Likely measured in hours
@LegoLas44941816 Yes freedom is fashionable again, but that’s been exposed an illusion.
@LegoLas44941816 @casertron3000 I wonder what their definition of freedom is.
@Morvern_C_ See my response to Mike below
@casertron3000 Oh of course, none of these people are going to risk their lives (hence "comfortable sanctimony"); but they won't be able to go back to bewailing "freedumb" so easily.

@LegoLas44941816 If they were enlisting to fight I would have some respect for them.

But they're not.

They're role-playing living in dangerous times whilst running minimal personal risk.

A terror of death is absolutely at the nub of this.

@LegoLas44941816 I don’t think it is actually as it’s rooted in risking other people not themselves. If COVID was zoomers watching a pandemic online, this is the same for war.

Pretty gross really.
